title.narrative: Challenging Shrinking Civil Space in oPt

description.narrative: The Palestinian Centre for Human Rights (PCHR) is a non-profit company, dedicated to protecting human rights, promoting the rule oflaw and upholding democratic principles in the oPt. In collaboration with Al Mezan and Al Haq, the project seeks to highlight the reality of increasingly shrinking space facing human rights defenders and the wider civil society in oPt. Civil society and HRDs playan essential role in society. Their ability to function freely and lawfully represents a cornerstone of modern society and an essential reflection of states# respect of human rights and basic freedoms, specially freedom of expression and association. This abilityis even more important in the context of situations of conflict and democratization, which, in the Palestinian case, is entrenched by the prolonged Israeli occupation of the oPt and the dynamics of the intra-Palestinian political division.

participating-org.narrative: PCHR Palestinian Centre for Human Rights

The former director of the Gaza Centre for Rights and Law, a partner of Novib from 1993 to 1995, founded the Palestinian Centre forHuman Rights (PCHR) in 1995. Early 2000 PCHR opened two field offices in the Gaza strip and in 2007 it opened a fieldworkco-ordination office in Ramallah to be able to monitor and to help victims of human rights violations more effectively. The organisation is also involved with the victims of violations of social, economic and cultural human rights and women#s rights. PCHR maintains many contacts with international organisations and is a member of several networks, such as the International Federation on Human Rights (FIDH), the Arab organisation for Human Rights, the International Legal Assistance Consortium (ILAC), theEuro-Mediterranean Human Rights Network (EMHRN), the International Commission of Jurists (ICJ), and the World Coalition against the Death Penalty. In 1996 PCHR and the Public Committee against Torture in Israel were awarded the Prize for Human Rights of the French Republic. In 2002 PCHR was awarded the Bruno Kreisly prize for human rights, in addition it received the UNAIS Human Rights Award.
